channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Regular tipping at Bus Stop, 9th October
item.description:
There is a person who regularly keeps throwing waste at the bus stop during night time, which later spreads into the pavement and inside our house, there was incident yesterday where he threw lots of alcohol bottles which was crushed and spread all over the road, our drive and the pavement causing health hazard to our children and pedestrians, which is why we had to clean it. However this goes on every day which is why we need the council to take action. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Lane, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated dog fouling, 9th October
item.description:
All along the pavement on pickford lane, between Oldfield and Herbert Road. This is repeatedly happening. Please put in stencils. This is a main road with lots of nearby schools, nurseries, shops and train station. Something needs to be done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Pickford Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The tenant called for your attention. He says he woke up to find a long metal at the back at his window, wrapped in a cellophane with a fragile label. He does not want to touch it because he does not know who the owner is and no one has actually comes around since Sunday when it was dropped. He is pleading that you should please come around so that this can be evacuated. The address 10 ROSS COURT, 3 NAPOLEON ROAD, E5 8TE, 9th October

item.title: Public footpath blocked, 9th October
item.description:
CPFC and its contractors have blocked the public footpath on CCR without either any advance notice or without displaying and notice of permission granted and timing of when the path will be closed. I therefore assume that no permission has been obtained from the council and enforcement action should be taken Further, they had applied tarmac to the step between the road and pavement to create a ramp of sorts but did not wait until this had set dry before opening the diversion. As a result, I used this with my dogs and their paws were covered in toxic tarmac. This is simply unacceptable

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatcham Street, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated fly tipping next to recycling bins, 9th October
item.description:
Since early September 2025 there has been piles of household waste left on the ground next to the recycling bins at Arnold Estate where I live (where Sweeny crescent meets the back of Devon mansions). I notice it every day as I take my son to school. There's usually a mixture of broken furniture, rubbish bags and bits of wood and plastic. Pieces get taken away every now and then but the pile just grows again. The worst incident involved a fire which damaged the lid of one of the recycling bins. This antisocial behaviour is not just unsanitary and unsafe but it also takes up valuable time of the council workers trying keep our estate a nice place to live.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 180-230, Sweeney Crescent, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
